content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is an example of a `show` method for the `FloatWithUnits` struct:
```julia
using Printf

struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, x::FloatWithUnits)
    @printf("%0.2f %s", x.value, x.unit)
end
```
This `show` method uses the `@printf` macro to format the output as a string with two decimal places and a space between the value and unit. The `%0.2f` format specifier is used to ensure that the value is printed with two decimal places, even if it is zero or negative.
